Hi "tester_junit",


On 9/29/06, tester_junit <sujal14@...> wrote:
>  I would like to test the MessageService ( that communicates through
>  JMS with Deployment service to process the request) by Mocking
>  JMSobjects.

I have no idea what these MessageService and Deployment service are? I
wonder if anyone else on this list knows? I don't remember seeing such
interfaces in the standard J2EE API. Are they specific to a particular
application server product? Are they specific to your project? If so,
and if it has any relevance to how or what you need to mock, it might
make sense to describe those for those of us for whom these terms
don't ring a bell.


On 9/29/06, tester_junit <sujal14@...> wrote:
>  I am new to easymock and wondering how should I go around Mock JMS
>  objects and verify that correct JMS APIs are called

I'd suggest dealing with this by splitting your problem into two steps:
A) Learn to use EasyMock on simple stuff
B) Learn how you should use the JMS API

Once you've clarified both of these, you should have little trouble
applying the concepts you've learned while doing A and B into mocking
the right JMS interfaces with EasyMock.

I assume you've read EasyMock's documentation [1] and gone through at
least some JMS tutorials [2] ?


-Lasse-

[1] http://www.easymock.org/Documentation.html
[2] http://www.j2eeolympus.com/J2EE/JMS/JMS.jsp
